## Theta and Hobs taken from angsd / realSFS
### South (FL, SC, NC) has greater theta than do New England pops (MA, RI, NH)

```{r echo = F}
library(visreg);library(reshape)
dat <- read.csv('data/theta_Hobs.csv')
dat$reg <- ifelse(dat$State%in%c("FL","SC","NC"),"S","N")
m <- lm(Theta~reg,data=dat)
visreg(m)
summary(m)
```

### Hobs is not signif different

```{r echo = F}
m <- lm(Hobs~reg,data=dat)
visreg(m)
summary(m)
md <- melt(dat[,c("reg","Theta","Hobs")])
print(cast(md,reg~variable,mean))

```

### When Florida is ignored, both theta and Hobs are significantly greater in the south.

```{r echo = F}
dat2 <- dat[!dat$State=="FL",]
m <- lm(Theta~reg,data=dat2)
visreg(m)
summary(m)
m <- lm(Hobs~reg,data=dat2)
visreg(m)
summary(m)
md <- melt(dat2[,c("reg","Theta","Hobs")])
print(cast(md,reg~variable,mean))
```
